historical.name: Historical Sites
historical.description: Sites of past organizing and protests

locations.name: Erb Memorial Union
locations.description: Main student union building where many organizations meet
locations.history: Center of student life since 1950. Site of numerous student organizing meetings and events.
locations.currentUse: ROAR coalition meetings every Friday at 4pm in Room 320

locations.name: Johnson Hall
locations.history: Site of numerous student protests and occupations, including anti-war demonstrations in the 1970s and climate activism in recent years.
locations.tips: Security is tight. Best approach is through scheduled meetings or organized demonstrations.

locations.name: Knight Library
locations.history: Study space that has hosted teach-ins and study groups
locations.currentUse: Quiet organizing meetings, research for campaigns
locations.tips: Reserve group study rooms for planning meetings

locations.name: Memorial Quad
locations.history: Historic site of major protests: Anti-Vietnam War rallies (1970s), Apartheid divestment shantytown (1985), climate strikes (2019-present)
locations.tips: Need permits for amplified sound. Great visibility for actions.
locations.permits: Contact EMU Event Services 2+ weeks in advance

locations.name: Bean Complex
locations.currentUse: Some student org meetings, wellness workshops

locations.name: Student Recreation Center
locations.description: Large meeting spaces available for student organizations

locations.name: Millrace Studios
locations.history: Historically progressive space supporting activist art and events
locations.currentUse: Benefit concerts, activist art shows, radical speakers

locations.name: Lawrence Hall
locations.history: Site of 1970 student occupation during anti-war protests

locations.name: 13th & Olive Intersection
locations.currentUse: Banner drops, visibility actions, student intersection
locations.tips: High foot traffic during class changes. Be mindful of pedestrian safety.
